title: Chapter listing inside Mighty Boosh DVDs
content:
Hi there,

I’ve got a pretty simple ID request this time around. Can you guys remind me which font this is? Please see the attached image. Thanks in advance :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [boosh-chapters.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/typophile.com/files/boosh-chapters.jpg) | 170.92 KB |

 [‹ !!! PLEASE READ THIS FIRST !!! Frequently Answered Questions](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq "Go to previous forum topic") [Old, Block, Imperfect, "Harmed" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/typophile.com/node/40312 "Go to next forum topic")
author: klokwerk

comments.content:
Not exactly that simple :)

[Cafeteria](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/detail.htm?pid=409142&AID=5529319) and [Myriad Tilt](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/detail.htm?pid=202891&AID=5529319) are sort of similar. But not very.

Indeed hard to pinpoint, on first look it reminded me of T26 fonts, I suggest you look at their [Grunge](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/style/Grunge) and [Organic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224220549/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/style/Organic) sections.
Hi Sam. I had in fact already checked those. No luck really :(

Is there a font closer to this than XBAND Rough? I’d link to a showing of that font, but I can only find downloads and I’m not sure if the font’s commercial or not. XBAND seems too... straight, for lack of a better word. However, XBAND is what I thought of when I saw this. Perhaps that will help in identifying the true font in use here?
